habitat_description: In Texas, this subspecies is known from only nine total specimens collected in the 1980's from Hansford and Lipscomb counties. This subspecie of prairie voles prefer tallgrass prairies, colonizing underground burrows and surface runways obscured by vegetation. They use corn and small grain fields during winter (Schmidly 2004).
